content: Google Nest Protect Smart Smoke & CO Alarm is tested, trusted, and highly recommended by experts.
Like in Nest Protect, it has a microphone so I can easily say, 'I'm just cooking' to stop false alarms, which is a great feature.
This review of the Google Nest Protect smoke and carbon monoxide detector highlights its many convenient features and overall performance.
In this review of the Google Nest Protect smoke and carbon monoxide detector, Consumer Reports highlights its many convenient features.
Note: Nest Protect, Nest Tag, and Nest Temperature Sensor will only appear in the Nest app, which can be frustrating for some users.
This smoke detector is photoelectric, dual smoke is better. The AA batteries need replacement every six months.
These are a waste of money. I am an idiot who has one in every room, ten in total.
Google sold the technology to First Alert. They work with existing Nests, but you have to use two apps.
I want full control over my security camera footage and on-prem recording is the most important feature for me.
The First Alert battery powered units are problematic. I'm still waiting for support to get back to me.
I've had the wired Onelink safe and sound for years, no false alarms, been a solid device and overall happy.
My nest protects are about to expire so i preordered the Owlâ€™s. It has impressive features.
My entire home is protected with Nest Protects and integrated with HomeKit through HomeBridge. I've had zero issues.
I like that the Nest Protect doubles as a path light at night in dark areas. It's worth the investment.
You either replace your entire house or you don't get them at all. You want all detectors to be on the network.
I like how they look and the pathlight + automatic testing works good. They are probably a bit expensive.
One of my Nest Protects is acting up due to poor wiring. The constant chirping is driving us crazy.
I've had 5 of them in my house for about 5 years and have pretty much no complaints, set and forget.
I love them, they went off without a hitch. I also love the night light function and the thermostat control.
They're very sensitive and don't integrate into the smart home which makes the expense questionable now.
I haven't had an issue with Nest. On the other hand, we've had 3 traditional smoke/co alarms fail recently.
My protect had a lot of false smoke alarms due to moisture from the shower without fan ventilation.
Alphabet/Google has given up on fixing basic problems as nagging issues are ignored. They are OK with it working.
When it works it's OK, but when it fails it's a steaming pile of crap. I'd be livid if I paid money.
I have had zero false alarms and like the fact that it facilitates better auto-away detection for my Nest.
